DataElement.preferredName: PASI Lower Limbs Scaling Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Response indicating the chronic plaque type psoriasis intensity of scaling of the lower limbs, using a 5-point rating scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Psoriasis Area and Severity Index Fredriksson Version Clinical Classification PASI Fredriksson Version - Lower Extremities: Desquamation/Scaling Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized index developed in 1978 by Fredriksson et al. that combines psoriasis disease severity (measured as erythema, infiltration, and desquamation) and body surface area involvement over 4 body regions (head, trunk, upper and lower extremities) to assess progress during treatment.:Psoriasis Area and Severity Index Fredriksson Version (PASI Fredriksson Version) Lower Extremities: Desquamation/Scaling symptom score._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Psoriasis Area and Severity Index Fredriksson Version Clinical Classification
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized index developed in 1978 by Fredriksson et al. that combines psoriasis disease severity (measured as erythema, infiltration, and desquamation) and body surface area involvement over 4 body regions (head, trunk, upper and lower extremities) to assess progress during treatment.

Concepts.longName: Psoriasis Area and Severity Index Fredriksson Version Clinical Classification
Concepts.definition: A standardized index developed in 1978 by Fredriksson et al. that combines psoriasis disease severity (measured as erythema, infiltration, and desquamation) and body surface area involvement over 4 body regions (head, trunk, upper and lower extremities) to assess progress during treatment.

Concepts.definition: Psoriasis Area and Severity Index Fredriksson Version (PASI Fredriksson Version) Lower Extremities: Desquamation/Scaling symptom score.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes; 0-None, 1-Slight, 2-Moderate, 3-Severe; 4-Very Severe

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exceedingly intense or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.
